CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: 40,41 As seen in Figure 3 , PffBB-n exhibits good crystallinity with d 1 -spacing of 21.00 , 22.63 , 24.16 , and 25.44 Å for PffBB-10 , PffBB-12 , PffBB-14 , and PffBB-16 , respectively , which arises from the strong aggregation ability of these polymers. Meanwhile , with an increase of the length of the alkyl side chains , the d 2 -spacing of PffBB-n polymers showed a descending trend of 3.84 , 3.82 , 3.77 , and 3.66 Å for PffBB-10 , PffBB-12 , PffBB-14 , and PffBB-16 , respectively , which indicated that PffBB-n with longer alkyl side chains exhibited enhanced ordered molecular packing. Notably , the longer the alkyl side chain , the closer the polymer aligned through π-π stacking is , which is attributed to the stronger interchain interactions of long alkyl side chains. Such strong πstacking ability and crystalline nature of PffBB-n may provide a highly ordered network for effective electron transport and exciton diffusion. Photovoltaic Properties. Solar cells using PffBB-n as a donor material and PC71BM as the acceptor material were fabricated with an inverted device structure of ITO / ZnO / PffBB-n:PC71BM(1 : 2 w / w ) / MoO 3 / Al. The active blend layer was prepared by means of spin - coating at different temperatures to investigate the impact of coating temperature on photovoltaic device performance , which was characterized under AM 1.5 G simulated solar illumination at an irradiation intensity of 100 mW cm^-2 . To achieve the high coating temperatures , the high boiling chlorobenzene ( 132 °C ) was used as a solvent even though chloroform is a stronger aggregation - induced solvent. Detailed device fabrication procedures can be found in the electrospray ionisation. The current density - voltage curves of BHJ PSCs fabricated at 60 , 80 , and 100 °C using a 3% CN as the solvent additive and their respective photovoltaic properties are shown in Figure 4 and summarized in Table 3 , respectively. It is important to note that the photovoltaic device performance is greatly affected by the active blend coating temperature. The decyl-substituted PffBB-10 - based device showed a good PCE of 8.22% with a high V oc of 0.93 V , a J sc of 14.62 mA cm^-2 , and a FF of 60.44% when the active layer was coated at 80 ° C. On the other hand , PffBB-10 - based devices fabricated at 60 and 100 °C spin - coating temperatures exhibited inferior photovoltaic performance with a lower J sc and a much lower FF of ∼ 56% except for a similar V oc . Furthermore , BHJ PSCs based on PffBB-12 , PffBB-14 , and PffBB-16 also exhibited the same trend in which their highest PCE was achieved by spin - coating the active blend layer at 80 °C .

Let's think step by step.

1. PffBB-10, PffBB-12, PffBB-14, PffBB-16

Paragraph: 40,41 As seen in Figure 3 , PffBB-n exhibits good crystallinity with d 1 -spacing of 21.00 , 22.63 , 24.16 , and 25.44 Å for PffBB-10 , PffBB-12 , PffBB-14 , and PffBB-16 , respectively , which arises from the strong aggregation ability of these polymers. Meanwhile , with an increase of the length of the alkyl side chains , the d 2 -spacing of PffBB-n polymers showed a descending trend of 3.84 , 3.82 , 3.77 , and 3.66 Å for PffBB-10 , PffBB-12 , PffBB-14 , and PffBB-16 , respectively , which indicated that PffBB-n with longer alkyl side chains exhibited enhanced ordered molecular packing. Notably , the longer the alkyl side chain , the closer the polymer aligned through π-π stacking is , which is attributed to the stronger interchain interactions of long alkyl side chains. Such strong πstacking ability and crystalline nature of PffBB-n may provide a highly ordered network for effective electron transport and exciton diffusion. Photovoltaic Properties. Solar cells using PffBB-n as a donor material and PC71BM as the acceptor material were fabricated with an inverted device structure of ITO / ZnO / PffBB-n:PC71BM(1 : 2 w / w ) / MoO 3 / Al. The active blend layer was prepared by means of spin - coating at different temperatures to investigate the impact of coating temperature on photovoltaic device performance , which was characterized under AM 1.5 G simulated solar illumination at an irradiation intensity of 100 mW cm^-2 . To achieve the high coating temperatures , the high boiling chlorobenzene ( 132 °C ) was used as a solvent even though chloroform is a stronger aggregation - induced solvent. Detailed device fabrication procedures can be found in the electrospray ionisation. The current density - voltage curves of BHJ PSCs fabricated at 60 , 80 , and 100 °C using a 3% CN as the solvent additive and their respective photovoltaic properties are shown in Figure 4 and summarized in Table 3 , respectively. It is important to note that the photovoltaic device performance is greatly affected by the active blend coating temperature. The decyl-substituted PffBB-10 - based device showed a good PCE of 8.22% with a high V oc of 0.93 V , a J sc of 14.62 mA cm^-2 , and a FF of 60.44% when the active layer was coated at 80 ° C. On the other hand , PffBB-10 - based devices fabricated at 60 and 100 °C spin - coating temperatures exhibited inferior photovoltaic performance with a lower J sc and a much lower FF of ∼ 56% except for a similar V oc . Furthermore , BHJ PSCs based on PffBB-12 , PffBB-14 , and PffBB-16 also exhibited the same trend in which their highest PCE was achieved by spin - coating the active blend layer at 80 °C .

Let's think step by step.

1. d 1-spacing of PffBB-n: The distance between the first set of planes in the crystal structure of PffBB-n.
2. PffBB-n: A series of polymers with different lengths of alkyl side chains.
3. alkyl side chains: The long hydrocarbon chains attached to the main polymer backbone.
4. d 2-spacing of PffBB-n: The distance between the second set of planes in the crystal structure of PffBB-n.
5. ITO: Indium Tin Oxide, a conductive material used as a transparent electrode in the solar cell.
6. ZnO: Zinc Oxide, a wide bandgap semiconductor used as a buffer layer in the solar cell.
7. PC71BM: A fullerene derivative used as an acceptor material in the solar cell.
8. w/w : Weight to weight ratio.
9. MoO3: Molybdenum Trioxide, a thin oxide layer used as a hole transporting layer in the solar cell.
10. Al: Aluminum, a metal used as a back contact in the solar cell.
11. high boiling chlorobenzene: A solvent with a high boiling point used to achieve high coating temperatures.
12. chloroform: A solvent used for aggregation-induced solvation.
13. CN: Carbon Nanotubes, used as a solvent additive.
14. PCE: Power Conversion Efficiency, a measure of the efficiency of a solar cell.
15. V oc: Open Circuit Voltage, the voltage at which the photovoltaic device generates no current.
16. J sc: Short Circuit Current Density, the maximum current density that a photovoltaic device can generate under standard test conditions.
17. FF: Fill Factor, a measure of the efficiency of the device at converting the maximum reversible voltage into useful current.

Such strong πstacking ability and crystalline nature of PffBB-n may provide a highly ordered network for effective electron transport and exciton diffusion. Photovoltaic Properties. Solar cells using PffBB-n as a donor material and PC71BM as the acceptor material were fabricated with an inverted device structure of ITO / ZnO / PffBB-n:PC71BM(1 : 2 w / w ) / MoO 3 / Al. Detailed device fabrication procedures can be found in the electrospray ionisation. Let's think step by step.

1. Crystallinity of PffBB-n polymers:
   - d 1 -spacing for PffBB-10: 21.00 Å
   - d 1 -spacing for PffBB-12: 22.63 Å
   - d 1 -spacing for PffBB-14: 24.16 Å
   - d 1 -spacing for PffBB-16: 25.44 Å

2. d 2 -spacing of PffBB-n polymers:
   - PffBB-10: 3.84 Å
   - PffBB-12: 3.82 Å
   - PffBB-14: 3.77 Å
   - PffBB-16: 3.66 Å

3. Coating temperature for photovoltaic device fabrication:
   - 60 °C
   - 80 °C
   - 100 °C

4. Solvent used for high coating temperatures:
   - High boiling chlorobenzene (132 °C)

5. Solar cell device properties:
   - PCE (Power Conversion Efficiency) for PffBB-10 based device at 80 °C: 8.22%
   - V oc (Open Circuit Voltage) for PffBB-10 based device: 0.93 V
   - J sc (Short Circuit Current Density) for PffBB-10 based device: 14.62 mA cm^-2

   - J sc for PffBB-10 based devices at 60 and 100 °C: lower than 14.62 mA cm^-2
   - FF for PffBB-10 based devices at 60 and 100 °C: ∼ 56%
   - Highest PCE for PffBB-12 , PffBB-14 , and PffBB-16: achieved by spin-coating the active blend layer at 80 °C.
